info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 7 at 7:46AM EDT until April 7 at 10:45AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg SC
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of western North Carolina, including the following county, Haywood.
* WHEN...Until 1045 AM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 743 AM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain had fallen early this morning along the Balsams. High levels of runoff will be seen through the Richland, Jonathan's and Cataloochee Creek basins. Please watch for rapid stream rises and flooding of low-lying areas along this creeks and select tributaries this morning.
- Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Waynesville, Lake Junaluska and Maggie Valley as well as parts of the Blue Ridge Parkway. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding or landslides threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via X using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 AM EDT THIS MORNING
